page.title: 13RELIGION IN N.W.NEWCASTLE.
page.content: Apart from a Jewish Reformed Synagogue the buildings for religious purposes are linked to the{Christian faith;}two Catholic,two Church of England,one Methodist,one United Reformed,one Christian Fellowship,a gospel hall and a Church of Jesus Christ of the Latter Day Saints (Mormons).The traditional churches tend to have{ageing {congregations}while the less formal approach of the gospel hall tends to be more attractive to the younger people.A survey of{180 pupils}in a Junior School (age 7-11) showed that {only 16 were regular attenders. Apart from services of worship the churches offer a{wide range of other {activities}throughout the week for example Scouts,Guides and other social clubs. Among the Christian churches there is a tendency to try to draw together in{combined Christian faith.
